  • I renamed T_max to T. The name is therefore inconsistent with CosineAnnealingLR, however, it also has different meaning. There is no actual maximum in CosineAnnealingRestartsLR. This is also a valid point for keeping the classes separated.
  • The variable i in the docstring now denotes both the number of performed restarts and the current run, i.e. the initial run is i = 0. This is consistent with numbering of epochs.

body:
I was thinking about my last two comments and have found them reasonable. I did the following chages:
- I use T_cur / T_i in [equation 5](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1608.03983.pdf), never reaching (possibly zero) eta_min. Now the behavior is consistent with TensorFlow.
- I renamed `T_max` to `T`. The name is therefore inconsistent with `CosineAnnealingLR`, however, it also has different meaning. There is no actual maximum in `CosineAnnealingRestartsLR`. This is also a valid point for keeping the classes separated.
- The variable i in the docstring now denotes both the number of performed restarts and the current run, i.e. the initial run is i = 0. This is consistent with numbering of epochs.

I updated the example plots:
![cosineannealingrestartslr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1244058/44909085-4864f480-ad1e-11e8-90cc-e65ba9b6605e.png)

The PR is now ready for the review.
